member.summary: This method is called (indirectly) by Wix# compiler just befor building the MSI. It allows embedding UI specific resources (e.g. license file, properties) into the MSI.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ManagedUI.InstallDirId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the 'installdir' (destination folder) directory. It is the directory, which is bound to the input UI elements of the Browse dialog (e.g. WiX BrowseDlg, Wix# InstallDirDialog).

member.summary: Sequence of the dialogs to be displayed during the installation of the product.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ManagedUI.ModifyDialogs
member.summary: Sequence of the dialogs to be displayed during the customization of the installed product.

member.name: T:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction
member.summary:
Defines WiX Managed CustomAction.
Managed CustomAction can be defined either in the Wix# script or in the external assembly or C# file. The only requirements for any C# method to be qualified for being Managed CustomAcyion is to have DTF Action signature public static ActionResult MyManagedAction(Session session), and be marked with [CustomAction] attribute.
If Managed CustomAction depends on any assembly, which will not be registered with GAC on the target system such assembly needs to be listed in the .
often needs to be executed with the elevated privileges. Thus after instantiation it will have set to false and set to Execute.deferred to allow elevating.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with properties/fields initialized with specified parameters.
member.param: Name of the CustomAction. The name should match the method implementing the custom action functionality.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor(WixSharp.Id,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with properties/fields initialized with specified parameters.
member.param: The explicit to be associated with instance.
Name of the CustomAction. The name should match the method implementing the custom action functionality.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with properties/fields initialized with specified parameters.
member.param: Name of the CustomAction. The name should match the method implementing the custom action functionality.
Path to the assembly containing the CustomAction implementation. Specify "%this%" if the assembly is in the Wix# script.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor(WixSharp.Id,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with properties/fields initialized with specified parameters.
member.param: The explicit to be associated with instance.
Name of the CustomAction. The name should match the method implementing the custom action functionality.
Path to the assembly containing the CustomAction implementation. Specify "%this%" if the assembly is in the Wix# script.

member.name: T:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentBootstrapperApplication
member.summary:
Defines Wix# bootstrapper managed application with no User Interface.
It is a design time 'adapter' for the canonical WiX managed bootstrapper application .
automatically handles events and detects the current package/product state (present vs. absent). The package state detection is based on the . If this member is no t then the Id of the lats package in the Bundle will be used instead.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentBootstrapperApplication.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The primary package identifier.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentBootstrapperApplication.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentBootstrapperApplication.AutoGenerateSources(System.String)
member.summary: Automatically generates required sources files for building the Bootstrapper. It is used to automatically generate the files which, can be generated automatically without user involvement (e.g. BootstrapperCore.config).
member.param: The output directory.

member.name: T:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA
member.summary: Implements canonical WiX managed bootstrapper application without any UI.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA.Run
member.summary: Entry point that is called when the Bootstrapper application is ready to run.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA.OnPlanComplete(System.Object,Microsoft.Tools.WindowsInstallerXml.Bootstrapper.PlanCompleteEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that gets invoked when the Bootstrapper PlanComplete event is fired. If the planning was successful, it instructs the Bootstrapper Engine to install the packages.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA.OnDetectPackageComplete(System.Object,Microsoft.Tools.WindowsInstallerXml.Bootstrapper.DetectPackageCompleteEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that gets invoked when the Bootstrapper DetectPackageComplete event is fired. Checks the PackageId and sets the installation scenario. The PackageId is the ID specified in one of the package elements (msipackage, exepackage, msppackage, msupackage) in the WiX bundle.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA.OnApplyComplete(System.Object,Microsoft.Tools.WindowsInstallerXml.Bootstrapper.ApplyCompleteEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that gets invoked when the Bootstrapper ApplyComplete event is fired. This is called after a bundle installation has completed. Make sure we updated the view.

member.summary: The MSI session

member.summary: The WIN32 handle to the host window (parent MSI dialog).

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
This constructor is to be used by the Visual Studio Form designer only. You should always use WixCLRDialog(Session session) constructor instead.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.#ctor(Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Session)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The session.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.Init
member.summary: Inits this instance.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.delta
member.summary:
There is some strange resizing artefact (at least on Win7) when MoveWindow does not resize the window accurately. Thus special adjustment ('delta') is needed to fix the problem.
The delta value is used in the ReplaceHost method.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.ReplaceHost
member.summary:
'Replaces' the current step dialog with the "itself".
It uses WIN32 API to hide the parent native MSI dialog and place managed form dialog (itself) at the same desktop location and with the same size as the parent.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.RestoreHost
member.summary: Restores parent native MSI dialog after the previous ReplaceHost call.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.MSICancel
member.summary: Closes the dialog and sets the this.DialogResult to the 'DialogResult.Cancel' value ensuring the setup is cancelled.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.MSIBack
member.summary: Closes the dialog and sets the this.DialogResult to the 'DialogResult.Retry' value ensuring the setup is resumed with the previous UI sequence dialog is displayed.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.MSINext
member.summary: Closes the dialog and sets the this.DialogResult to the 'DialogResult.OK' value ensuring the setup is resumed and the UI sequence advanced to the next step.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.ShowAsMsiDialog(WixSharp.WixCLRDialog)
member.summary:
Shows as specified managed dialog.
It uses WIN32 API to hide the parent native MSI dialog and place managed form dialog at the same desktop location and with the same size as the parent.
It also ensures that after the managed dialog is closed the proper ActionResult is returned.
member.param: The dialog.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.GetMSIBinaryStream(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the embedded MSI binary stream.
member.param: The binary id.
